main event: A rated pilot of the U.S. Air Defense Command observed a brilliant light resembling a ball, approximately 15-20 feet in diameter, for about 30 minutes on 28 October 1951.
interesting points: The object moved silently and disappeared in a descending vertical glide., The object was initially bluish-green in color before changing to a sort of white., The sighting lasted around 30 minutes., The observer provided a direct and convincing report of the details., The document emphasizes the object's behavior as remarkable and unusual.
witness description: rated pilot of the U.S. Air Defense Command
